# The Crash Package Manager
[![Website](https://img.shields.io/badge/website-%23.svg?style=for-the-badge&logoColor=white&color=%23F94144&logo=data:image/svg%2bxml;base64,)](https://crash-lang.org)
[![Discord](https://img.shields.io/badge/discord-%23.svg?style=for-the-badge&logoColor=white&color=%23F3722C&logo=discord)](https://dc.crash-lang.com)

**This project is heavily work in progress!**

The **Crash package manager, Crasher**, is a versatile tool tailored for the Crash programming language.
It facilitates the creation of libraries, executables, and various components that can seamlessly integrate into Crash projects. 
With Crasher, developers can efficiently manage dependencies, making it easier to include external code into their projects.

One of the key functionalities of Crasher is its ability to streamline the configuration of the Crash compiler. 
Developers can use Crasher to fine-tune compiler settings, ensuring a more tailored and efficient compilation process. 
This feature enhances the flexibility and customization options available to developers working with the Crash programming language.

Moreover, Crasher supports the development of multi-module projects, 
enabling the interconnection of multiple projects into a cohesive whole. 
This capability promotes a modular and organized approach to software development, 
allowing developers to efficiently manage complex systems and dependencies across various components.

In essence, Crasher serves as a comprehensive tool for managing the entire development lifecycle in the Crash programming language. 
From simplifying compiler configurations to supporting multi-module projects, 
Crasher enhances the development experience, 
making it more efficient and user-friendly for Crash programmers.
